column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on abilify discmelt  for 3 years and I was able to lose 20 pounds with diet and exercise. I also maintained straight A's and graduated with honors.  It has been my miracle drug because it works for schizophrenia.  Please do not stop making it!

column1: 1$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/11/2013 9:01:04 AM$Reviewer: ellensmithee
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $1$1$1$"Abilify gave me hallucinations and delusions on the second day when I NEVER had them before. When I complained to my doctor and insisted I would not take it
column3: he threw a fit! Then I learned Medicare pays $683 to the drug-maker for this poison. Apparently
column4: my doctor needed me on this drug to pay for the mags on his Porsche. Do NOT take this poison!"

column1: 2$Condition: Additional Medications to Treat Depression$5/7/2013 2:13:23 AM$Reviewer: adonna45
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$1$"I took it for a little over a month. It made me think and do completely psychotic
column3: out of character stuff. Every morning when I woke up I never knew where I was and every day I thought I was places that I cannot begin to explain. One day I didn't know where I was for about 20 minutes
column4: but I was just sure that my ex-husband would be sitting in a chair just outside of my room. Actually there was no room outside of my door to begin with
column5: which made that even weirder. And the fact no men lived at this facility
column6: as it was a shelter for battered women. My ex wasn't even the one I was hiding from
column7: as we had been divorced over a decade. Then one day I really snapped. Was paranoid and mad and scared the staff and so for the second time in 2 weeks they called in a squad of mental health professionals to deal with me. Tem minutes later I forgot the whole thing. Then approx. ten days later I did it again (whatever it was) so they called the cops and the squad people again. I was escorted by four people to the mental ward for observation and didn't know why they were acting so funny. Anyway after all the stories told to me about my behavior over the last month or so
column8: I realized the abilify was the common denominator and stopped taking it that day I and I was fine the very next day. People who know me as a rule are never surprised at my unique behavior and roll with it. But I had become out there and was being 'socially unacceptable""   "

9$Condition: Mania associated with Bipolar Disorder$3/30/2008 3:19:10 AM$Reviewer: Brandon_McCowan, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $1$1$4$I was given this to take by my doctor in conjunction with Lithium
column2: I would take one a day in the evening with lithium 3 times a day (forgot dosage) and I would ""lash out"" at people
column3: including my wife and kids. I stopped taking it
column4: and continued with the lithium and saw/felt no difference at all. After I could no longer pay for the Rx
column6: and to this day (this was over a year ago) I am worse than ever
column7: I am very quick to get angry
column8: and I say things to those I love without thinking prior to
column9: and I think and mumble things to myself that are even worse. I am unclear if this is due to the meds
column10: but I am leaning towards yes. Zyprexa worked well as a child
column11: but I gained a ton og weight. I have been on more meds than I can count since I could remember
column14: and the effects of the wrong Rx. Be careful when deciding."
